intro: Pimpinella engleriana, commonly known as the Engler's cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves with finely divided leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to South America and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
